intro: Pleurogyne deltoidea, commonly known as the delta pleurogyne, is a flowering plant native to the eastern coast of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its deltoid-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in coastal heathlands and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Pleurogyne deltoidea is often found in areas with mild, temperate climates and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
